content: Homepage of Malay Bhattacharyya Resume Malay Bhattacharyya Still learning ... 01 About Malay Bhattacharyya is currently an Associate Professor of Machine Intelligence Unit, the Coordinator of Centre for Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, and an Associate Member of Technology Innovation Hub on Data Science, Big Data Analytics, and Data Curation at Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata. He is a certified Design Thinker from MIT Sloan School of Management and holds a doctorate in Computer Science from Indian Statistical Institute. He has a couple of decades of teaching and research experience including short academic visits at Stanford University, University of Ljubljana, and Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore. He served in the Assessment & Search Committee, ACM Publications Board and The Lancet COVID-19 Commission: India Task Force during 2023-24 and 2021-22, respectively. His current research interests encompass Computation for Social Good and Computational Healthcare. He has published research studies in high-impact journals like Cell, Nature Medicine, The Lancet Microbe, The Lancet Regional Health - Southeast Asia, and top-notch conferences like AAAI, IEEE ICDE, ACM CHI, ACM CSCW. His research has received generous funding from DRDO, Google, DST and MeitY, Government of India, totaling about INR 4 Crores (~ USD 0.5 Million). He is a recipient of the Impact Scholars Award from Google (2021), Young Engineer Award from INAE (2018), Young Engineers Award from IEI (2016-17), BIRD Award from Bioclues Organization (2015), Young Scientist Award from ISCA (2013-14), and won several best paper and best reviewer awards. He became a Fellow of climaTRACES Lab, University of Cambridge in 2024, an INAE Young Associate in 2018, and a Sir Visvesvaraya Young Faculty Research Fellow in 2015-16. He advises NGOs like MDCRC, mentors Startups like Assessli, and reinforces Talent Development to companies like Tata Steel. 02 Career January 2023 - To date Associate Professor Machine Intelligence Unit ISI, Kolkata Courses: Computational Molecular Biology and Bioinformatics - Fall 2024, Fall 2025; Introduction to Computing - Fall 2024, Fall 2025; Introduction to Programming and Data Structures - Fall 2023; Computing Lab - Fall 2023; Management of Data - Spring 2023, Fall 2023, Spring 2024, Fall 2024, Spring 2025; Operating Systems - Spring 2023; Database Management Systems - Spring 2023, Spring 2024, Spring 2025 Computing Systems II - Spring 2025.
